snippet: Most in Toronto seem to be greeting the event with a shrug, and Mayor John Tory is so exasperated that he has begun lecturing them about their attitude.
abstract: Toronto’s new Mayor John Tory lectures constituents on their lack of enthusiasm for Pan-American Games, event that officially opened in city after six years of planning; only 800,000 of 1.4 million available tickets have been sold despite discounts and media reports of abundant hotel availability; residents appear to be shunning games to avoid traffic snarls or as protest of $2 billion city spent in preparation.
lead_paragraph: Most in Toronto seem to be greeting the event with a shrug, and Mayor John Tory is so exasperated that he has begun lecturing them about their attitude.

headline.main: In an Indifferent Toronto, the Pan-Am Games Land With a Thud
headline.print_headline: Pan-American Games Land With a Thud in an Indifferent Toronto
